main event: A circular unidentified flying object, about the size of the planet Mars, was observed by a U.S. citizen and his wife while traveling in Southern Italy on September 16, 1957.
interesting points: The object was white in color and did not have any exhaust or make any sound.
The object maintained a straight course and constant altitude during the 5-minute observation.
The observers described the object as similar to a V-1 rocket in flight.
Weather conditions were clear with good visibility, and no thunderstorms were reported in the area.
The observers were unable to take any photographs of the object.
sighted object: a circular unidentified flying object, about the size of the planet Mars
witnesses: a U.S. citizen and his wife
